body:
<!--- Remove sections that do not apply -->

This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to bitcoin-core.

General bitcoin questions and/or support requests and are best directed to the [Bitcoin StackExchange](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com).

For reporting security issues, please read instructions at [https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/](https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/).

### Describe the issue
0.14.2 starts, connects to 8 peers, shows 4 years and 48 weeks behind, and sticks right there
### Can you reliably reproduce the issue? Happens every time I start Btc 0.14.2
#### If so, please list the steps to reproduce below:
1.Click on the bitcoin icon on my desktop. 
2.
3.

### Expected behaviour
Tell us what should happen
Btc should go to building databases 
### Actual behaviour
Tell us what happens instead  Easier to show you....see screenshot

### Screenshots.
If the issue is related to the GUI,
![stalled gui graphic](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31745842/30185543-ead9c022-93ef-11e7-8a52-779b1345e533.PNG)

### What version of bitcoin-core are you using?
List the version number/commit ID, and if it is an official binary, self compiled or a distribution package such as PPA.

See:  https://bitcoin.org/bin/bitcoin-core-0.14.2/      bitcoin-0.14.2-win64-setup.exe                     16-Jun-2017 06:39            13857192
### Machine specs:
- OS: Windows 7 Professional 64-bit SP1
- CPU:  AMD A8-5600K
Trinity 32nm Technology
- RAM:  32.0GB Dual-Channel DDR3 @ 666MHz (9-9-10-24)
- Disk size: 931GB Western Digital WDC WD10EZRX-00L4HB0 ATA Device (SATA)
- Disk Type (HD/SDD):  ?????

### Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process.
This is normally the contents of a `debug.log` or `config.log` file. Raw text or a link to a pastebin type site are preferred.
title: 0.14.2 starts, connects to 8 peers, shows 4 years and 48 weeks behind, and sticks right there....and, after reading it,  I don't have the faintest clue what "Contributing Guidelines" said.
